meanings.definition: A large triangular sail set above the skysail on a sailing ship.
meanings.sent1: The moonsails caught the wind and propelled the ship forward.
meanings.sent2: The moonsails fluttered gracefully in the breeze as the ship sailed on.
meanings.sent3: The moonsails looked like giant kites flying high above the ship.
meanings.sent4: As the moonsails billowed, the ship seemed to dance with the ocean waves.
meanings.sent5: The moonsails, like great white wings, carried the vessel across the sea.

meanings.definition: The uppermost sail on a mast.
meanings.sent1: Sailors climbed up to adjust the moonsails at the very top of the mast.
meanings.sent2: The moonsails at the highest point of the mast captured the strongest winds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the moonsails and enjoyed the view.
meanings.sent4: The moonsails reached for the sky, eager to touch the clouds above.
meanings.sent5: The moonsails stood tall like proud flags waving in the sky.
